result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deserae Dawn Thayer

records.addlTxt:
10:36 AM Cases 21CF308, 21CF309, 22CF25, 22CF37, 22CF60, 22CM11, 22CM12 called together.  Defendant, Deserae Dawn Thayer, appeared with Attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Atty Erdman appears by video.  Def appears in person.  Def waives all in-person hearing KIV.    Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Erdman: def pleading to 22CM11- retail theft, 22CM12- retail theft, 21CF308- misdemeanor crim dmg to prop (to be amended to misdemeanor), 22CF25- misd bond jump and OAR; stipulates to restitution in 21CF308 is $2530, in 22CM11 is $25.99, and in 22CM12 $129.95; remaining charges and counts and uncharged read-in for a bond jump to be DRI; joint rec for 3 years probation, withheld sentence, costs on 22CM11; DNA only on remaining counts; absolute sobriety, DOC testing, AODA and follow through, get valid DL, programming per DOC.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  State moves to amend Count 1 of 21CF308 down to misdemeanor; granted.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters guilty pleas.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 1 of 21CF308, Counts 2 and 3 of 22CF25, Count 1 of 22CM11, and Count 1 of 22CM12 and orders a JOC; remaining counts, cases, and uncharged read-in are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement, notes 56 days jail credit.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
21CF308- misdemeanor damage to property: 3 years probation, withheld; $2530 restitution; $200 DNA
22CM25- 
Ct 2- misdemeanor bond jump: 3 years probation, withheld; $200 DNA
Ct 3- OAR:
22CM11- retail theft: 3 years probation, withheld; $25.99 restitution; $443 costs
22CM12- retail theft: 3 years probation, withheld; $129.95 restitution; $200 DNA
Conditions of probation:
Restitution will be paid in full from the cash bond posted.  Absolute sobriety.  Regular drug and alcohol testing.  AODA and follow through.  Obtain GED.  Obtain valid DL.  Parenting class.  All other programming per DOC.  56 days jail credit if revoked.  Def to pay $50/month to probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If def pays in full and completes all conditions within 2 years, can petition to discharge off of probation after 2 years.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

ADDRESS INFO for Deserae Dawn Thayer
Current: PO Box 233, Danbury, WI 54830 United States  (Effective: 04-14-2022)
Prior: 7173 Loon Creek Cir, Danbury, WI 54830

The defendant must post $2,000 additional cash bond to be released from custody. $3,000 cash total to be posted to cover cases 21CF308, 21CF309, 22CF25, 22CF37, 22CF60, 22CM11, and 22CM12.  No contact with Dollar General Store in Danbury, WI. No contact with any victims, their residences, or places of business.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:50 AM Cases 21CF308, 21CF309, 22CF25, 22CF37, 22CF60, 22CM11, 22CM12 called together.  Defendant, Deserae Dawn Thayer, appeared with Attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Cases 21CF308, 21CF309, 22CF25, 22CF37, and 22CF60 were set for preliminary hearing, defendant indicates it intends to waive in pursuit of a global resolution that has been reached.  Witness is released.  Cases proceed to Waiver of Preliminary Hearings:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State to file informations.  Atty Erdman recites agreement, def pleading to misdemeanor retail theft in 22CM11; 22CM12 retail theft; 21CF308 amending to misdemeanor crim dmg to prop; 22CF25 misdemeanor bail jump and OAR; restitution of $2530 in 21CF308; $25.99 in 22CM11; $129.95 in 22CM12; joint rec is for 3 years probation withheld; remaining cases and counts to be DRI.  Discussion of bond- court revises bond, def to post $2000 additional cash and court to set aside the previous forfeiture for a total of $3k bond that must be posted; same conditions.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.

03:05 PM Cases 21CF308 (Initial), 21CF309 (Initial), 22CF25 (Initial), 22CF37 (Initial), 22CF60 (Initial), 22CM11 (Initial) and 22CM12 (Initial) called together.  Defendant Deserae Dawn Thayer in court with attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Attorney Michelle Erdman by phone.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case on for Initial Appearances.    Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered on all misdemeanors.  As to felonies, PH, waiving time limits.  Court denies bond modification at this time due to number of missed appearances.  May file for a new bond modification.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:16 PM Cases 21CF308, 21CF309, 22CF25, 22CF37, 22CF60, 22CM11, and 22CM12 called together.  Defendant Deserae Dawn Thayer in court, in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deserae Dawn Thayer appeared by video means.  Atty Otten updates Court- office conflict, PD's office continues to look for an attorney for the defendant.  Atty Otten is not making a special appearance today.  Court addresses def, asks for argument regarding her multiple requests for a bond modification.  State argues against modification of bond.  Court denies her bond motion.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Initial appearances needed in all of the files.  Def to keep reaching out to PD, is advised of other options.  Bond continues.
